<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
E-COMMERCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/02/ecommerce-boom-strains-delivery-networks?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We're Gonna Need a Bigger Reindeer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="lots of christmas boxes" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjkwL2xvdHNfb2ZfY2hyaXN0bWFzX2JveGVzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With the holiday shopping season jingle bell rocking, shippers are straining under the weight of Americans’ online ordering habits. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Having reached allotted capacity, UPS told its drivers to stop picking up packages at six major retailers, including Nike and Gap, to maintain performance standards, the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ups-slaps-shipping-limits-on-gap-nike-to-manage-e-commerce-surge-11606926669?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ reports</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon is even offering a <a href="https://twitter.com/MGTalksRetail/status/1333827357535326212?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rebate</a> (we’ve seen $2–$3) for some of the company’s digital products if you select the “No-Rush Shipping” option, presumably so it can reduce the strain on its own fulfillment network.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Boom times </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ll look back on this past week as a milestone in e-commerce adoption. During a five-day stretch that included Black Friday and Cyber Monday, online shopping increased 44% over last year, per the National Retail Federation. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Shopify, a platform that’s home to 1+ million merchants, reported that Black Friday sales increased 75% annually to $2.4 billion, </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/11/30/black-friday-2020-online-sales-broke-records?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per Retail Brew</a></span><span>. Its stock is up more than 160% this year. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>At the same time, far fewer people are shopping at brick-and-mortar locations. U.S. store visits </span><span><a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/black-friday-traffic-at-u-s-stores-down-52-even-as-online-retail-sales-hit-record-high-01606666788?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dropped</a></span><span> more than 50% on Black Friday from last year. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Follow the money </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The investors with the biggest pockets are making bets on the physical infrastructure that powers e-commerce: warehouses.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Just yesterday, Bloomberg reported that private equity firm KKR is close to </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-02/kkr-nears-800-million-warehouse-deal-with-e-commerce-booming?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">acquiring</a></span><span> about 100 warehouses in the U.S. for more than $800 million (the deal could close next week).</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But KKR is playing catchup—fellow PE giant Blackstone bought </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-24/the-world-needs-warehouses-now-and-blackstone-s-got-them?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than $25 billion worth</a></span><span> of industrial properties last year alone. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>With consumers feeling more comfortable shopping online and companies rapidly expanding their e-commerce infrastructure, the retail industry has been catapulted years into the future by the pandemic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Dive deeper: </strong>1) A <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/24/magazine/shopify.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times feature on Shopify</a> and 2) a <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/11/10/special-delivery-emerging-tech-powers-ecomm-discovery-delivery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">report</a> on the tech behind e-commerce from Retail Brew and Emerging Tech Brew.  </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STIMULUS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/02/coronavirus-aid-democratic-leaders-back-compromise-bill?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Only Bill Everyone Likes Is Billy Joel
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bill Capitol Hill Covid-19 aid McSchumer Pelostimulus gridlock. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sorry, that was nonsense—we’ve just been regurgitating similar summaries on a Covid-19 aid bill so often we figured if we just smushed the relevant words together, you’d get the idea. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But there’s been some movement. </strong>Yesterday, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi <a href="https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-donald-trump-coronavirus-pandemic-steven-mnuchin-bills-c5084f0deaae19864820e6cc9eab10c8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced their support</a> for a split-the-difference compromise bill put forward by a bipartisan group of senators. Some details… </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The price tag is $908 billion. Republican leadership wants a $550 billion package, Dems have favored one closer to $2 trillion. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It includes a “liability shield” for businesses and other organizations that have reopened, a measure Schumer and Pelosi resisted up until now. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Additional jobless benefits of $300/week, a smaller supplement than the $600 weekly infusion from the spring.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$160 billion for state and local governments, schools, paycheck protection subsidies, and transportation.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Momentum has been building in the past few days, but time is extremely running out. Democratic Sen. Mark Warner <a href="https://www.yahoo.com/lifestyle/sen-warner-stupidity-steroids-congress-184935744.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told NBC</a> that failing to pass a relief bill before Congress breaks for the holidays would be “stupidity on steroids.” </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/02/discovery-inc-launches-streaming-service?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Look Who Discovered Streaming
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Guy Fieri eating soup  " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l4EoZunhI8mM5c4ak/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Guy Fieri eating soup  " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/l4EoZunhI8mM5c4ak/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In case late-night binges of <em>Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives </em>weren’t scratching your Guy Fieri itch, Discovery Inc., the owner of cable channels Animal Planet, HGTV, Food Network, and more, is launching its own <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/2/22018581/discovery-streaming-service-launch-date-price-shark-week-hgtv-food-network?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">streaming service</a>, Discovery+.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s going big</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Discovery is offering 55,000 episodes from 2,500 different shows upon launch, the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/02/discovery-to-launch-streaming-service-in-january-for-4point99-per-month.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most content</a> of any new streaming service. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It’s also partnering with Verizon to give 55 million customers one year of Discovery+ for free, a similar strategy to the Disney+ debut. That deal with Verizon netted </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-01/disney-streaming-service-faces-test-when-verizon-freebies-end?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">about 20%</a></span><span> of Disney+ customers in the first two months.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Discovery execs also think original, unscripted content like Bobby Flay beating up on amateur chefs, or big sharks eating smaller sharks, will help Discovery+ attract viewers who aren’t willing to commit to four seasons of <em>The Crown</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Competition is stiff, but Discovery's niche offerings and robust <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-02/discovery-joins-crowded-streaming-market-with-reality-tv-focus?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">international presence</a> (it has the European streaming rights for the Olympics) might be enough to differentiate the latecomer. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s time you really got to know yourself. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And right now, they’re offering their best deal of the year: $0 down when you sign up for a six-month membership.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/02/years-largest-acquisition-not-think?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Data Wins Acquisitions
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Quick, can you name the biggest acquisition of 2020 so far? Uber <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/06/food-delivery-landscape-consolidates-uber-buys-postmates?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buying</a> Postmates? Morgan Stanley <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/morgan-stanley-acquire-etrade-13-billion?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">picking up</a> E-Trade? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nope, it’s S&P Global’s deal, announced Sunday, to take over data provider IHS Markit for $44 billion. And yesterday, the London Stock Exchange (LSE) <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-refinitiv-m-a-lse-eu-exclusive/exclusive-lse-to-win-eu-approval-for-27-billion-refinitiv-deal-sources-idUSKBN28C28Y?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">picked up the baton</a> when it reportedly landed EU approval for its $27 billion purchase of Refinitiv, another data provider. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on? </strong>On Wall Street and in the City of London, financial data <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/cd99579c-e01f-4a71-a124-e9c03598e5b9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is the coin</a> of the coin-making realm. Bloomberg was the first to pick up on the trend in the 1980s, spawning competitors—but the sector is now rapidly consolidating. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Intercontinental Exchange, LSE rival and owner of the NYSE, has bought both mortgage finance tech platform Ellie Mae and data provider Interactive Data in the past few years. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The former NYC mayor and memelord’s namesake company still towers over the financial data market. Bloomberg commanded about 33% as of last year, per Burton-Taylor Consulting, but Refinitiv wasn’t far behind at 21%. </p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/02/apple-spotify-tiktok-release-yearendroundups?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brace Yourself: The Year-End Roundups Are Here
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="WInter is coming meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjk0L2JyYWNlX3lvdXJzZWxmLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Imgflip</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like your lower back pain, year-end-lists have returned once again. Here’s a look at some of 2020’s trendiest trends.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">App Store: </strong>Unsurprisingly, Zoom was the <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/iphone-users-downloaded-zoom-and-among-us-more-than-any-other-apps-this-year-2020-12-02?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most downloaded</a> free app of the year, with TikTok and Disney+ following closely behind. On the gaming side, <em>Among Us</em> edged out <em>Call of Duty: Mobile</em> and <em>Roblox</em> which is super sus. Even more sus...the global pandemic simulator <em>Plague Inc. </em>came in at No. 2 on the <a href="https://apps.apple.com/story/id1535572612/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paid gaming charts</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Spotify: </strong>If you’ve managed to avoid Instagram Stories these past few days, we should tell you that Spotify released its annual Spotify Wrapped data on Tuesday. The biggest winner? Spotify. It was the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-02/spotify-technology-soars-to-record-amid-2020wrapped-buzz?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">No. 1 trending topic</a> on Twitter yesterday afternoon, and its stock jumped 12.6%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">TikTok: </strong>While 420Doggface208 vibin’ to Fleetwood Mac set the interwebs <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/07/ocean-spray-fleetwood-mac-capitalize-viral-tiktok-video?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">aflame</a>, it was only the second-most popular TikTok video of the year. The top spot goes to breakout star, <a href="https://newsroom.tiktok.com/en-us/the-year-on-tiktok-top-100?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bella Poarch</a>, lip syncing to British rapper Millie B’s diss track, “Soph Aspin Send.”</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Congratulations to Brew’s Bookshelf alum Sarah Frier, whose inside story of Instagram, <a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781982126803?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>No Filter</em></a>,<em> </em>just won the FT & McKinsey Business Book of the Year Award. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Each year, the award celebrates cream-of-the-crop business reads. Here are some other picks from recent years that caught our attention: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781501102264?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Janesville: An American Story</em></a></span><span><em> </em></span><span>by Amy Goldstein traces the impact of a shuttered GM factory on a Wisconsin community in the years after the Great Recession.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780143109341?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>How Music Got Free</em></a></span><span><span> by Stephen Witt explores how the simple MP3 file transformed music sharing and led to an entire generation of music pirates. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781610398404?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Boom</em></a></span><span><span> by Michael Shnayerson depicts how a handful of contemporary art dealers turned the postwar art market into a lucrative investment vehicle for the wealthy, sending prices skyrocketing. </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Head to <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew’s Bookshelf</a> to see the rest of our recommendations. </p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Must-read: </strong>Every year, we look forward to Tom Whitwell’s list of the 52 things he learned. <a href="https://medium.com/fluxx-studio-notes/52-things-i-learned-in-2020-6a380692dbb8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The 2020 edition just dropped</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Font savant: </strong>All of the <a href="https://www.notion.so/e873b52e0cc54f2981acc430417ba61d?v=05acdd40b0564920be69f5347f619bc3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">free fonts</a> you can get through Google, set to the couplet of a beloved sitcom intro. Plus, get copy inspiration from actual <a href="https://www.goodemailcopy.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">company emails</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Cool maps: </strong><a href="https://www.lightningmaps.org/#m=oss;t=3;s=0;o=0;b=;ts=0;?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Lightning</a> and <a href="https://www.windfinder.com/#3/31.8029/-64.5117?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wind</a>, in real time. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Seven:</strong> It’s an iconic 1995 film that did not help the unboxing trend, but more importantly, it’s the number of people <a href="https://www.howmanypeopleareinspacerightnow.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">currently in space</a>.</p>

GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There's less than a month left in the year, but 2020 isn’t done pumping out wild news stories. Three of the following headlines are real, and one we made up. Can you spot the fake?  </p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Drake is selling a </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/12/02/entertainment/drake-candle/index.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+rss%2Fcnn_topstories+%28RSS%3A+CNN+-+Top+Stories%29&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scented candle</a></span><span> that smells like...himself"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"Vatican asks Instagram to investigate </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-pope-instagram/vatican-asks-instagram-to-investigate-mysterious-papal-like-of-model-idUSKBN2801UN?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mysterious papal 'like'</a></span><span> of model"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"KFC rolls out self-driving 5G '</span><span><a href="https://interestingengineering.com/kfc-rolls-out-self-driving-5g-chicken-trucks-in-china?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chicken trucks</a></span><span>' in China"</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"San Luis Obispo In-N-Out warns of </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/tsX3YMWYzDPjAARfeg/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wild bear attacks</a></span><span> in the area, but customers show up anyway"</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith the holiday shopping season jingle bell rocking, shippers are straining under the weight of Americans’ online ordering habits. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHaving reached allotted capacity, UPS told its drivers to stop picking up packages at six major retailers, including Nike and Gap, to maintain performance standards, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ups-slaps-shipping-limits-on-gap-nike-to-manage-e-commerce-surge-11606926669?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eWSJ reports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon is even offering a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MGTalksRetail/status/1333827357535326212?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erebate\u003c/a\u003e (we’ve seen $2–$3) for some of the company’s digital products if you select the “No-Rush Shipping” option, presumably so it can reduce the strain on its own fulfillment network.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBoom times \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’ll look back on this past week as a milestone in e-commerce adoption. During a five-day stretch that included Black Friday and Cyber Monday, online shopping increased 44% over last year, per the National Retail Federation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eShopify, a platform that’s home to 1+ million merchants, reported that Black Friday sales increased 75% annually to $2.4 billion, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/retail/stories/2020/11/30/black-friday-2020-online-sales-broke-records?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper Retail Brew\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. Its stock is up more than 160% this year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAt the same time, far fewer people are shopping at brick-and-mortar locations. U.S. store visits \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/black-friday-traffic-at-u-s-stores-down-52-even-as-online-retail-sales-hit-record-high-01606666788?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edropped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e more than 50% on Black Friday from last year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFollow the money \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe investors with the biggest pockets are making bets on the physical infrastructure that powers e-commerce: warehouses.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eJust yesterday, Bloomberg reported that private equity firm KKR is close to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-02/kkr-nears-800-million-warehouse-deal-with-e-commerce-booming?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eacquiring\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e about 100 warehouses in the U.S. for more than $800 million (the deal could close next week).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut KKR is playing catchup—fellow PE giant Blackstone bought \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-24/the-world-needs-warehouses-now-and-blackstone-s-got-them?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore than $25 billion worth\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of industrial properties last year alone. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eWith consumers feeling more comfortable shopping online and companies rapidly expanding their e-commerce infrastructure, the retail industry has been catapulted years into the future by the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Dive deeper: \u003c/strong\u003e1) A \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/24/magazine/shopify.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBill Capitol Hill Covid-19 aid McSchumer Pelostimulus gridlock. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSorry, that was nonsense—we’ve just been regurgitating similar summaries on a Covid-19 aid bill so often we figured if we just smushed the relevant words together, you’d get the idea. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut there’s been some movement. \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday, Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Speaker Nancy Pelosi \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/joe-biden-donald-trump-coronavirus-pandemic-steven-mnuchin-bills-c5084f0deaae19864820e6cc9eab10c8?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced their support\u003c/a\u003e for a split-the-difference compromise bill put forward by a bipartisan group of senators. Some details… \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe price tag is $908 billion. Republican leadership wants a $550 billion package, Dems have favored one closer to $2 trillion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt includes a “liability shield” for businesses and other organizations that have reopened, a measure Schumer and Pelosi resisted up until now. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAdditional jobless benefits of $300/week, a smaller supplement than the $600 weekly infusion from the spring.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$160 billion for state and local governments, schools, paycheck protection subsidies, and transportation.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eMomentum has been building in the past few days, but time is extremely running out. Democratic Sen. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn case late-night binges of \u003cem\u003eDiners, Drive-Ins and Dives \u003c/em\u003eweren’t scratching your Guy Fieri itch, Discovery href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/12/2/22018581/discovery-streaming-service-launch-date-price-shark-week-hgtv-food-network?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s going big\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDiscovery is offering 55,000 episodes from 2,500 different shows upon launch, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/02/discovery-to-launch-streaming-service-in-january-for-4point99-per-month.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost content\u003c/a\u003e of any new streaming service. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIt’s also partnering with Verizon to give 55 million customers one year of Discovery+ for free, a similar strategy to the Disney+ debut. That deal with Verizon netted \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-10-01/disney-streaming-service-faces-test-when-verizon-freebies-end?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" months.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDiscovery execs also think original, unscripted content like stiff, but Discovery's niche offerings and robust \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-02/discovery-joins-crowded-streaming-market-with-reality-tv-focus?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" Uber \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/06/food-delivery-landscape-consolidates-uber-buys-postmates?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuying\u003c/a\u003e Postmates? Morgan Stanley \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/20/morgan-stanley-acquire-etrade-13-billion?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epicking up\u003c/a\u003e E-Trade? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNope, it’s S\u0026P Global’s deal, announced Sunday, to take over data provider IHS Markit for $44 billion. And yesterday, the London Stock Exchange (LSE) \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-refinitiv-m-a-lse-eu-exclusive/exclusive-lse-to-win-eu-approval-for-27-billion-refinitiv-deal-sources-idUSKBN28C28Y?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epicked up the baton\u003c/a\u003e when it reportedly landed EU approval for its $27 billion purchase of Refinitiv, another data provider. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/strong\u003eOn Wall Street and in the City of London, financial data \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/cd99579c-e01f-4a71-a124-e9c03598e5b9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis the coin\u003c/a\u003e of the coin-making realm. Bloomberg was the first to pick up on the trend in the 1980s, spawning competitors—but the sector is now rapidly consolidating. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIntercontinental Exchange, LSE rival and owner of the NYSE, has bought both mortgage finance tech platform Ellie Mae and data provider Interactive Data in the past few years. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe former NYC mayor and memelord’s namesake company still towers over the financial data market. Bloomberg commanded about 33% as of last year, per Burton-Taylor Consulting, but Refinitiv wasn’t far behind at 21%. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike your lower back pain, year-end-lists have returned once again. Here’s a look at some of 2020’s trendiest trends.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eApp Store: \u003c/strong\u003eUnsurprisingly, Zoom was the \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/iphone-users-downloaded-zoom-and-among-us-more-than-any-other-apps-this-year-2020-12-02?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost downloaded\u003c/a\u003e free app of the year, with TikTok and Disney+ following closely behind. On the gaming side, \u003cem\u003eAmong Us\u003c/em\u003e edged out \u003cem\u003eCall of Duty: Mobile\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003eRoblox\u003c/em\u003e which is super sus. Even more sus...the global pandemic simulator \u003cem\u003ePlague Inc. \u003c/em\u003ecame in at No. 2 on the \u003ca href=\"https://apps.apple.com/story/id1535572612/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaid gaming charts\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpotify: \u003c/strong\u003eIf you’ve managed to avoid Instagram Stories these past few days, we should tell you that Spotify released its annual Spotify Wrapped data on Tuesday.
